meanings.sent1: The straw was fistular, allowing the liquid to flow through easily.
meanings.sent2: The fistular shape of the tunnel made it perfect for the small animals to hide in.
meanings.sent3: The fistular tree branch looked like a natural slide for the squirrels to play on.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, long and fistular, cascaded down her back like a waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The fistular design of the building made it stand out among the other structures in the city.

meanings.definition: Having a fistula or tube-like passage
meanings.sent1: The fistular wound required special care to prevent infection.
meanings.sent2: The fistular connection between the two organs allowed for direct fluid transfer.
meanings.sent3: The fistular pipe in the garden sprinkler system made watering the plants efficient.
meanings.sent4: The fistular opening in the wall was a secret passage to the hidden room.
meanings.sent5: The fistular channel in the rock formation was created by years of erosion.

meanings.sent1: The fistular plant stems were strong and flexible.
meanings.sent2: The fistular structure of the telescope made it easy to focus on distant objects.
meanings.sent3: The fistular appearance of the straw made it perfect for sipping cold drinks.
meanings.sent4: The fistular veins in the leaf distributed water efficiently throughout the plant.
meanings.sent5: The fistular shape of the sculpture gave it a modern and sleek look.
